page.title: 13HURLEY VILLAGE 1985
page.content: {HURLEY TODAY There are approximately 1100 people in the parish of Hurley which also includes Burchetts Green.About 1/4 of the population are of retirement age. Apart from the small Council House estate most housing is concentrated along the main street which also contains the Post Office and a small supermarket. There are 3 public houses and a public carpark. This is an affluent area reflected in the housing which dates back to the 12th century and up to the present day.Brick and flint cottages are well in evidence. The surrounding farmland has become amalgamated into Hurley Farms Ltd.They own 290 acres & grow potatoes,wheat & barley.150 grazing cattle are kept.500 caravans stand on former farmland.
